I was hoping for a darker colour - since we are running with a fruit theme let's say ...pomegranate?  blood orange?  But alas, it is raspmelon.  Waterberry.  It is not a bad looking ring, but I do have to admit the extent of the wear I've gotten out of  it so far is to put it on, hold it under different light sources and debate on the true colour.  (And I'm not saying that I did this, but if one were to take a sharpie to the coloured stone, one might alter the darkness of the colour. reviewText: This isn't the style/design for me.  It's too 'grandma-like'  I thought it might be cuter and younger appearing due to other reviews, but it's not.  I prefer the tie-dyed versions through other sellers.  The material is different as well, not the stretchy T-shirt style that I also prefer but a more still and less flowing version.  I suppose if I were anorexic it might look good, but for fuller endowed women like me, it looks like an old lady's top.  I doubt if I'll wear it, but I might give it to my mother-in-law or someone older that it might fit and they might like it.  I'm 61, and it still looks old on me, so unless you're really young and don't care about how you 'appear' in age and you are somewhat 'big' in size (it does make me slender) then it's not a very flattering look on middle-age women.  The colors are really bright too.  But yeah, it's totally not what I expected on me.
summary: Okay for the young and large, but not for middle-age and slender.

reviewText: It'd be nice if it can be packaged with more items and since many TMNT "weapons" are not sold in Asia region, I am hoping there can be more choice for shoppers

I just received my 1 ctw 14K white gold 3-prong earrings from Netaya.  In short:

*Customer service was wonderful
*Shipping was one day late, but considering it was free and I only had to wait three days instead of two, I can't fault them too much for this
*I received what I ordered
* I am MORE than satisfied.

The diamonds are gorgeous.  I was very skeptical having never worked with Netaya before, and although most of their reviews were positive, there were some real horror stories out there.  Also, in my research on diamonds, I'd read very bad things about the clarity level of diamonds I purchased (I2 - I3).  Nevertheless, the 30-day return policy gave me the confidence to give Netaya a try.

Well, I don't know if I just got lucky with these or what, but they are stunning.  Do they have inclusions?  Yes, but I had to go looking for them with a magnifying glass, and the only reason I did look for them was because I knew that with this type of diamond something had to be there.  The inclusions are black, but fortunately there is no cloudiness in these.  I'm not a diamond expert, but all I see when I look at them is sparkle, and I believe that is all any casual observer will see.

The price was absolutely amazing.  I am so happy with these that I had to put a review up.

I will shop with Netaya again because, even if I did just happen to get lucky with these, their 30-day return policy makes shopping with them risk-free.  And for the prices, it is definitely worth a try.

The diamonds sold by this company contain heavy carbon deposits.  As a result, the diamonds are dark in color and don't sparkle like one would expect for the money paid.  I'm still waiting to receive a full refund after returning almost 3 weeks ago.  I do not recommend purchasing from this company if you're looking for a diamond that truly catches the eye.

This Gold Cross Necklace by SmitCo LLC is Fabulously Feminine!
The 3/4" x 5/8" Yellow Gold Plated Cross Pendant features Eleven 1/8" Sparkling Crystals, which are Nestled within a "Box" Style Frame.
While the Top and Back of this Cross Charm are Solid, the Multi-Faceted Crystals can be Fully Viewed through the Front, Side and Bottom portions of this Cross's Very Unique Design.
The Charm has an Opening at the Top of the Body of the Cross, through which SmitCo has strung a Sturdy but Delicate 15" Adjustable Yellow Gold Plated Rope Chain with a 14 link Chain Extender on one end and an easy to manipulate Lobster Claw Clasp on the other.
While SmitCo advertises this Beautiful Cross Necklace for Young Girls, it would be equally delightful for women of all ages.
I am in my early 60's and would be proud to wear it with both day and evening wear.
Smitco packages this Gold Cross Necklace inside a Silver "Hologram" Designed Box which is perfect for gifting as is.
Not sure if it is part of the normal packaging or if I just got lucky, but mine even included a Very Pretty Green Gift Bag with Golden Flowers!
This Company Ships Quickly and provides Excellent Customer Service. They offer a High Quality Product and are a True Pleasure to do business with.
I received my Gold Cross Necklace at a reduced cost in exchange for testing and review and I am Extremely Pleased to give it my Highest Recommendation!
summary: This Gold Cross Necklace by SmitCo LLC is Fabulously Feminine!

They run a little big. On first appearance they are very cute. We got these for my daughter's princess-tea-party themed birthday. Her decorations were all pink and gold and she wore a fluffy pink pettiskirt with a custom white pink and gold shirt. On the day of the party she looked adorable. They quickly became my daughter's favorite pair of shoes. She wanted to play dress-up everyday so she could wear these shoes. She has several princess costumes that they paired well with. They are beautiful and don't look cheap, but literally after only a month and a half of having them the straps tore off at the seam. My daughter was sorely disappointed. She didn't play outside in them cuz we didn't categorize them as "play" shoes. She primarily wore them inside and to church or other functions where she needed to dress appropriately. They were great while they lasted, they just didn't last long even with easy use. I'm glad we got them for her birthday because they went perfectly with the princess theme, but I wouldn't purchase them for wearing to school or for everyday wear. And if you do decide to purchase them I'd watch your little one closely in them, cuz when the strap broke on one of the shoes the other shoe got caught in them and my daughter got pretty banged up in the fall. And all she was doing was walking from our living room to her bedroom. Smh. So disappointed these didn't last longer.

This is not truly a "one size fits all" sweater. My male friend, who is about 5'8", and a healthy average weight, barely fit into it. If he raised his arms up in the air, the sweater would expose his abs and the sleeves would shorten to expose his wrists. I'm not sure what size man this was intended for, but I'd say it's the equivalent of a men's small, maybe a medium (that runs small). Fortunately, it's comfortable enough to wear he wants to keep it and does enjoy wearing it. Just know that A) It's not for tall, portly or "large" dudes and B) It ships from China, so don't be in a hurry to receive it.

This dress is just perfect for my bridesmaids. It is very similar to Donna Morgan's Rhea One shoulder($189), which is what I needed this dress to match too. So for $30, I got the best bargain. Great knee length, right above the knee. Provides great support in bodice offering comfortable boning and cups. No bra, needed. Does run a size small, so if u need a size 0 order a 2 etc. I'm usually a size 4, and it did fit but I needed someone to zip me up. The dress flares out at the hips, so it only needs to fit your waist measurement. Coral and Honey Peach colors are beautiful and matched perfectly with the Coral ombre color scheme I was going for.

What I really love about this dress is that you can see the beautiful sweetheart neckline through the chiffon. Makes it look so romantic and just perfect for our Hawaiian wedding.

Pictures:
First Pic: My lighting isn't the best, and the dress needs to be steamed. But you can see that it fits nicely, and knee length is just right.
Second Pic: From Left to Right, Donna Morgan (Blush), Fashion Plaza (Honey Peach), Fashion Plaza (Coral), Donna Morgan Rhea (Coral)
summary: Perfect Bridesmaid dress for hawaiian wedding

First: This is a huge watch. I did search for Women's watches and this showed up.

Pros: Self-winding. This is great. I have so many watches in the graveyard that have dead batteries and I forget to take them to the shop.
Looks great. I love seeing the internals of the watch. That was the real selling point. I love that it has the date and the day. It does have a 24 hour dial as well, and that doesn't do me much right now, but if I was still on the ship taking logs I guess it would help me remember if it was 0700 or 1900 - when there's no daylight to help me. Fits! I have super-stick arms. I took out all the links, and it fits like a loose bracelet which for me is amazing.

Con: Sometimes I think it speeds up, but only by a few minutes. I'm still keeping my eye on it.
summary: Cool Watch for men or women.

But I examined them very carefully and here and there is some of the blue/pink/rainbow flash that everyone wants in these stones. There is hardly any of that going on. If you are like me and make jewelry this probably isn't you best option. As the saying goes, "you get what you pay for". However if you are also like me and do crystal work, these will be good for grids. I have them soaking right now and then I will charge them. I'm hoping they have some good energy. Listen there is a guy up the road from me that has a rather large crystal shop and I know that he would have charged me $10 for two of these. So they really are a good deal. Shipping was EXTREMELY fast coming from China. I ordered these from an individual vendor not Amazon. So for grid work or just some pretty stones these are great. They included a cute little red bracelet as a thank you gift. It's really nothing special, but I thought it was a very nice touch. I will definately be a repeat customer. Good job!

reviewText: I like this bag a lot more than I thought I would. I bought it as a flyer because it was cheap ($25). The canvas is durable and the leather is of nice quality. The external buckles are fake and the pockets close with magnets. But the zippers are of very high quality. This makes a great gym or travel bag. Depending on how you pack you can get two or three days worth of clothes in this thing. The canvas is forgiving, allowing you to over stuff the bag. That is not so great if you are using it as a cabin bag where there are size restrictions, but it is great if you need a weekender The original price of this bag was something like $75. Most of the time the sale price is pretty close to what the item is worth, with the original price inflated beyond what any rational human would pay. This one, though, feels to me (admittedly, not an authority on bags) like $75 would be pretty reasonable.

These are fairly solid, classic monogram links.  They also seem to be sturdy enough to last and not break with repeated use.  I feel a little bad for taking off two stars, but here's why, and perhaps I'm being unfair here.  I ordered two sets of these, each in different letters, so I could use one of each for my first and last initials.  I know, I know, they offer these as singles as well as pairs, but since the single links aren't on Amazon Prime, the shipping makes the singles almost the same price as a pair. So (for only a couple dollars more) I purchased two pair, like I said, in case I ever lose one.  Now the problem: The letters aren't the same size.  Yes, each pair matches its mate (an "A" matches the other "A", for example), but doesn't necessarily match any other letter in size (letter "A" is different than letter "B"). The boxes they arrived in were even slightly different, leading me to believe they might be manufactured in different places for the same company.  And though they're very similar otherwise, and maybe no one would notice the difference when placed on your opposite sleeves, and though it seems a petty thing to subtract points for, it's worth mentioning.
summary: I like, but with a small qualifier...

I give it four stars. I love this wallet, I've been using it for about a half of a year, I carry it in my front right with my pens and my car keys, so it sees a bit more abuse than if it was by itself. I got a light brown/tan version of it. It looks very very nice. Its clean, minimal. no real frills example a logo stamped into the leather on the inner left. there is a nice little outside pocket on the wallet which I use for my school ID. Easily able to pull from it and put back in without removing the entire wallet.
Its very very nice. I love it. The leather is nice, and its held up very nicely. The only complaints I have are the fact it is very short height wise, so it can't hold a standard receipt in it without it sticking out. Another issue I have had is the inside of the bill pocket, the seam splitting a bit, so the leather that wraps around to the inside of the bill pocket was flapping around. It was mostly a nuisance so I super glued it back down. There is only three card slots on the left, and then a bit bigger bulk pocket on the inside of it. There is only an id pocket on the right side.

So in summary
+Fits front pocket nicely
+Very no-frills
+Thin
+Reasonably Priced
+Durable, no real ripping. Only issue the bill pocket issue
-Bill pocket flap issue
-Not enough slots for cards
-Can't handle too many bills in the bill pocket before being hard to fold in half (Example 14 twenties makes it harder to bend)
summary: Great wallet for your front pocket.

The biggest minus is that the RFID of this wallet only blocks two things:  Jack and Squat.  The main reason I bought this was to ensure that my proximity chips in my IDs and cards stay safe.  I had an old black RFID leather wallet from thinkgeek that has worn out, and it truly blocked everything.  I performed the same tests with both wallets, using security badge proximity readers of different frequencies and manufacturers--HID systems and S2 systems.  They all went right through this wallet no matter what pouches I put the cards in.  It never blocked a single read attempt.  The old wallet blocked every read every time.

Thought I'm hanging onto this as it is a nice brown wallet, I want others to know that if RFID is a requirement, you should pick a different wallet.  When travelling, I will move all my goods to my worn-out wallet.  On other notes, I like the size and feel of the wallet.  Yes, the credit card pouches are tight, but are breaking in already and pulling out cards is not an issue after a few days.
summary: Those seeking complete RFID blocking should look elsewhere

reviewText:
I absolutely adore this dress!  So very well made and excellent quality.  Very flattering for my pudgy body.  I ordered the 1x/18W in tall, and it's simply perfect.  For reference, I am 5'10", about 245 lbs, with a 38DDD-40DD bra size, and usually wear 1x or 18w sizes.  So it was definitely true to size.  The band sits right below the breast, and I measure about 43" there (for reference).  I've ordered other talls from eshakti, and they were at the floor or even longer (I'll just have a seamstress hem them up for a few bucks), but this dress was just perfect--it just barely grazes my ankles. The adjustable sleeves are great.  The fabric is very soft and flowy--not stiff at all--but substantial enough that I won't need to wear a slip if I don't want to.  I washed this inside out in my washing machine on a gentle cycle, and then dried it on low, and it didn't shrink or anything--took all the shipping wrinkles out, so I didn't have to iron it.

FYI, on eshakti's own website (not their site on amazon), they have zillions more gorgeous dresses, and you can customize each piece to suit you best.  For example, you can ask them to change the length of a knee-length dress to calf-length.  You can just a deep-v neckline to a more shallow neckline, and even change the v-neck to a square or round or such.  You can change the sleeves on many items as well--from sleeveless, to cap sleeves, or short sleeves, etc.  They charge just $8 to do this.

I'm definitely keeping an eye on eshakti's offerings here on amazon as well as on their website.  Very high quality, and well worth the price.
summary: So very well made and excellent quality. Very flattering for my pudgy body

reviewText: Loved this tunic. Long enough with ample sized pockets.

These shoes are the most comfortable Jordans I have ever owned, and that is saying a lot since I have been buying Jordans since the original "gotta be the shoes" Jordan IV's.

The huge jumpman logo can be seen from far away so everybody knows what you are wearing immediately. The black/carbon gray colors go along with almost any outfit and the fully woven upper is as lightweight and comfortable as a sock.

There is almost nothing bad about these shoes except the price tag, it is a little high at $225 retail, but now that these shoes are all gone in stores, their value is undeniable and will climb even higher with the dedicated sneaker head crowds.

The first time I wore them I got lots of compliments and only got 1 hater, he was a shoe salesman at Foot Locker and he told me he didn't like them. I told him I would not like them either if it took my entire paycheck to buy them, and he pretty much shriveled up and went away after that.

Anyways, I am completely happy and satisfied with my purchase.

reviewText: Super comfortable.  Fits great.

I have an old, non elastic, cadet style cap that I could (and did) wear all the time with never a problem. I also have a dorfman pacific cowboy-style hat. Same Deal. Well, I bought this hat to wear as an alternative to my trusty cadet cap. But after an hour I had to take it off, and I am in no hurry to put it on again. To say it fits small would be deceptive. It is the right size for my head (if it were any larger it wouldn't fit) It's just that persistent slight pressure of the elastic all around my head starts to give me a headache. Another thing to note is that the brim is flat on the hat I received, not curved like the picture. The color is exactly like the picture, though (I ordered maroon) and it does seem to be made of high quality material.

Update: well over a year later I still own this hat, and it now bears the scars and stains of all manner of outdoor adventures. The elastic broke in because I no longer worry about headaches. Knowing what I know now, when it is time to retire this hat Ill probably be back here.
summary: Flexfit Gives Me a Headache - breaks in

This evening clutch surpasses all of my expectations.  It is stunning!  I was hesitant, at first, to order it because I feared it might not be as nice as I had hoped.  I've been burned before -- who hasn't? With so many crystals and such detail, if the workmanship isn't first-rate, the bag could arrive with some "jewels" already missing; if the materials aren't excellent, then it could simply look cheap and tacky.  It was a gamble, but one that really paid off.  I was absolutely delighted to open the package and find such a lovely, elegant bag.  Every crystal was intact (and the manufacturer also provides a little plastic bag with some replacement crystals -- just in case.)  I am planning on pairing this bag with a black evening suit -- a little jolt of drama to raise the outfit to something special. And now, to practicalities.  With all the crystals, it is a bit heavier than many other evening bags, though not, in my opinion, to a negative degree.  Also, the interior is smallish.  I would not expect the larger phones to fit inside. For example, my iPhone5, within its Lifeproof case, does NOT fit.  I would have to remove it from the case in order to carry it with me.

I don't think that I've ever spent so much money on a t-shirt, but I'm glad that I did.  I bought this shirt specifically for hiking and backpacking.  Here's a list of what I love about this shirt: Fits, feels and looks like a normal cotton t-shirt, except that it's even more stylish (unlike all other technical tshirts that I own). It is odor resistant and moisture wicking.  It has reat thermal properties (keeps me warm when it's cold out, and cool when it's hot).  And lastly, have you ever put on a wet t-shirt?  It feels horrible, BUT not this woolly shirt.  It feels just as good soaking wet as it does dry...amazing.  One thing to think about: One day I pulled it out of a drawer, and found that bugs ate a couple holes in the collar :(.  So now, I store the shirt in a zip lock bag.  I hope that keeps the critters from munching on my most expensive t-shirt.

We received a sample of this top at no cost and for our evaluation and review. These are our own comments and we am not affiliated with either the manufacture or Amazon.

This dress is just beautiful and exceeded my expectations!!! It fits perfectly and is comfortable - just perfect for my summer wedding. I am very happy with it, gorgeous bridal did ask me for my measurements and they made the dress accordingly. I would recommend this dress to someone looking for a pretty summer/spring dress for sure.

Overall it ended up OK and I did like the dress and I receive a lot of compliments.  I was expecting, based on the pictures in other reviews that it would have been longer in the front (below the knee).  Seemed like the torso part was short (which may have just been my thoughts based on the picture on the website it was probably right) - I am only 5' 3 1/2" tall and I have a short torso.
I would suggest asking for a few more measurements like height, and length from shoulder to waist.  Very few alterations were necessary but one thing I didn't understand and didn't see in the picture for Gorgeous Bridal (I did see it in the pictures of what appeared to be the same dress but from a different vendor) was a netting along the neckline.  Luckily it was something that my seamstress could do a little cutting and tucking and made it disappear.  It has the perfect neckline with out that.
Again - overall it was the perfect dress for our outdoor wedding that was more casual than formal.
Unfortunately - I do not have any decent pictures back yet to share.
summary: Overall OK - but a few suggestions

I really enjoy the purse.  I use it every day.  It's a darker color, good for fall and good to hide any dirt/marks.  Multiple pockets and the middle zipped part are my favorite.
Love this bag!  Great size, well made, light weight!!  A new favorite!

My last purse was a Fossil and I think this one has a lot more going for it. This purse is not too rigid and it fits snugly and comfortably on the shoulder. My Fossil was rigid and I would constantly be 'bumped into', in a crowd. That has not happened with this soft nylon. The sides can be cinched--in, as needed, with the tassels as well. The color is a rich brown and goes with most anything.
The inside is amazing and just what I was hoping for. Two sides to the inside with the divider-zipped pocket in the middle. The middle pocket is large. To one side of the middle pocket is a large open area with a cell-phone pocket (fits an iphone 5 perfectly) and another zippered (albeit smaller) pocket on the outside wall. The other (interior) side also has a large open area with four open pockets along the outside wall with three spots (additionally) for pens, pencils or lip gloss. Enough room for sunglasses, reading glasses, coupons, gum, etc. The magnetic closer is strong and stays closed--even with a lot in the purse. At different times, I may carry a water bottle, ipad, papers to and from work, a large wallet--this purse handles it all.
This purse is well-designed and well-made. I expect to have it for a long time. The leather handles on my Fossil began to break down over the last year, which makes me question the quality of materials used. This is my fourth Dooney & Bourke and I don't know why I ever strayed with my last purchase--it won't happen again.
Thanks to Amazon, the authenticity is real and the delivery was as expected....no worries.
summary: This is a nice purse--you won't be disappointed.

I will not lose my 2 carat studs with these backs. Great backs

i have a pair of large studs set in platinum. the posts were made to accommodate la pousette clutches, which are very sturdy and expensive. they operate by pressing little side catches whenever you put them on or remove. if you don't press down on the sides, the earring isn't coming off. they would be perfect, except that my studs droop because the back isn't big enough to support the weight of the stones.

i wanted to try LuxLocks since they have the plastic backing attached, and i thought, offered some kind of locking system. when securing the back you need to push hard. taking them off isn't as easy as a regular back that just slides off, but i wouldn't necessarily say these lock. you have to pull hard, but that's all you have to do and to me, that doesn't really qualify as a locking device.
still, these backs are comfortable and do a good job of supporting a heavy earring. the fit is very snug and feels extremely secure. i can wear my studs with confidence without fears of losing a valuable stone.

since the backs are forced on and off i do worry the tension on the internal spring will loosen in time.
i feel they are priced well, considering they are gold, but i wish they were offered in a more affordable and durable stainless steel.
i would have given them 5 stars if the backs were actually locking, as described, but again, i do like these very much and would purchase again.
summary: a very good option for heavy studs

reviewText:
Based on the size chart, I ordered the large just in case (I'm 5'3", 113 lbs for reference; 34C-25-35 for specific measurements) and it's actually a bit loose. I should've gotten the medium for that tighter, sexier fit but I was really worried it would've been too small since it is from China and they are notoriously known for being too small. I'd say that this time, the fit is as expected. Material is some kind of polyester or rayon? The color and style is just as pictured but there isn't a side slit as the title suggests. It's single layer so be mindful of what you wear underneath! Or don't. Whatever. The beading are all in place. Nothing loose or missing. I'd recommend handwashing and air drying this baby to make sure it stays that way. It did smelled a bit funky but that'll wash right off. Otherwise, this is a classy, sexy dress that can be worn for just about any occasion.

Disclaimer: I've received this dress at a discount in exchange for my unbiased review.

Saves lots of time & stress keeping toddler skin from getting burned, including the scalp! Easy one zipper access to the diaper zone. Totally easy to put on - not tight, dries fast, looks adorable & the hood keeps sun out of baby girl's eyes. Burn free SPF 50 without smearing endless sunscreen on an unwilling squirming body!

Love it.  My 18mo old burns easily so I needed something full coverage. Did a great job and she didn't even try to take the hood off that protected her head. Dried fast and she wore it in and out of the water no problem. Didn't get overheated dry either. Will definitely buy another next year.

Great layering tops.  I'm 5'2 and 110 with a large-ish bust, and I bought the size S.  They fit great, snug enough to layer but not so snug that they're uncomfortable.  They're pretty thin and sheer, which is what I was looking for, but you'd probably need to wear a cami under if you're looking to wear these as a main, uncovered top.  For the price, 100% worth it.

I'm about 123lbs and usually wear a size small in tops.  I have fairly long and thin arms so the length was perfect, but the arm sleeves were skin tight... almost to the point where I was having trouble getting them through.  I was looking to wear these under another t-shirt, so they work for me, but unless you have tiny stick arms, you will definitely want to order up a size.  The fitting around the body was also pretty tight and really form fitting.  The material is very thin, and is pretty see-through and probably should only be worn underneath a t-shirt unless you want everyone to see what you have going on under there.
summary: Very form fitting and super tight in the arms, but great for thin layering underneath a t-shirt.  Order up a size!

reviewText: I love these and wear them everyday.

Active Basic Camis-This is the third time Ive bought the Active Basic Camis w/Built-in Shelf Bra through Amazon. The first time was a 2-pak through the one seller. They were perfect so I ordered a 4-pak but the 4-pak was only available through a different seller. I figured it would be a consistent match as they were titled the same Active Basic Long Camis in Large w/ Built-in Shelf Bra. Boy, was that a wrong assumption. They weren't even Active Basic brand but the sellers own & they didn't have a shelf bra but two foam pads sewn in a sling that after one washing was a wadded up mess. So being a PollyAnna trooper I tried again, this time I made sure it was through the same first seller & I got a 2-pak exactly the same size & listing as the first time I bought them. They fit great & all was well until my back began to hurt from a scratching chaff. Turns out on comparing these to the first ones I bought, these have the elastic straps sewn in backwards so the scratchy heavy duty thread that binds the straps to the halter in back along with the tacked down material rubs against the shoulder blades. The first ones bought have the straps tacked down facing the halter away from the skin. I don't know why consistency is a problem but I cant seem to get proper Active Basic Camis. Im going to shop around for another brand & hope for a better product.
summary: Consistancy Probelm Every Time I Order, I Get Different Item or Design Flaw

I am due to have my baby next week, and wanted these so I had something comfortable, easy to pop my ladies out, and somewhat supportive so I didn't need to wear a bra. reviewText: Perfect!

The only complaint I have is that it is from downtown LA, the garment district, where most of the items sold are produced in sweat shops. It's difficult to purchase ethical items.

Aside from that, back to the coat: It fits just as expected. Maybe a hair on the big side, but I normally wear a Medium and the Medium fits well. It has just enough room for a sweater or a couple thin layers underneath, if you need to bundle up.

I would not suggest this coat for very cold climates. For instance, on a 50-60 degree night, this would be fine with a layer or two. If you live where it snows or gets near freezing, this isn't the coat for you.

The strings that pull the waist in are short, and seem to be more for visual appeal than actually function.

Overall, I'd purchase it again. It'll be ideal for casual days as the weather here in California cools.

I finally received this charming elegant lady butterfly scarf today.  It took a long time to get to me probably because of some trouble with the clearance at the Customs. The seller is very prompt in responding to my inquiries and promised to send me another one if I wouldn't receive the scarf in the end. I am glad I finally got it in my mail. The scarf is beautiful and looks exactly as it is shown in the picture.  I saw that some reviewers complain of the stitches. Well, the scarf is not perfect but it is charming and elegant with the cute butterflies.  That's enough.  For the price it is good enough and I have no complaints.  Think about the shipping fee.  The seller could barely make money from the scarf unless the company sells thousands of it.  I absolutely recommend this elegant scarf with pretty butterflies to all women who have a passion for scarves like me.

As others have mentioned the scarf is long and wide but the quality is not very good but the price is a reflection of this. The two scarfs I received were stitched terribly and I can't give them out as gifts due to this. The stitching was separated and the string was hanging from the scarf on one of them. They are soft to the touch and very light. If the stitching was better and full square I would have rated it a five based on pricing. The product came in ahead of schedule and the packaging was in a small packet from China. I am disappointed in the product.

I bought this for my daughter for Christmas and she really likes it. The blue "gem" on the inside was actually stuck through the silver part when it arrived, but I was able to pop it back into position so no harm no foul.
Pretty from afar, but not great up close. Chain looks bad, and the item looked ready to break in half. Ok for fun, but wouldn't use it as a cosplay item or a gift.

In the photos I've provided, from left to right, the yellow one is my second purchase (I bought cheap off ebay and regretted it.  It is not even symmetrical.) the middle is the item in I purchased most recently (and the item for this review), and the far right is my original.  (The blue soul gem was my first and favorite purchase, but the blue soul gem's metal is now turning green. [very very sad face]  )

I'm not so fond of the default chain that comes with this item [green soul gem], but now that I've worn it a few times, I'm not seeing any signs of the metal turning green.  (All of the other cosplay soul gems I've had up until now ended up turning green, and there was not a whole lot I could do about it.)  This purchase (green soul gem) is the first necklace that is clearly not made out of cheap metal.  You can still see the casting lines where the metal came together.  (Actually, the top of the necklace doesn't really line up with the casting lines on the bottom.  So the green one isn't really 100% symmetrical, either.)

I found another chain that compliments the necklace a bit more.  (The chain I replaced it with looks more ornate, I think.)

This green soul gem up for review comes off a bit more gaudy where it's so much larger.  I don't get as many compliments on this item as I did when I wore my original blue necklace.  (The smaller blue one is something I purchased at Colossalcon in Sandusky, Ohio back in 2012 in person.)

Truthfully, even after my green soul gem was delivered, I still will opt to wear my blue soul gem sometimes.  It looks more delicate, and has a less subtle feel to it.

The coin in the photo is for scale, and it is a dime from the 1940s (Mercury dime).  It's the same size as a regular dime.

The box in the background came with the cheap yellow soul gem off of eBay.  The eBay one came with matching rings, and 4 other different color soul gems for about $20.00.

I'm still trying to find a really wicked looking Grief Seed.  So far, no luck.  I'll find a crumby looking one on Etsy every once in awhile.

reviewText: Love this bag!! Great purchase!
very well made, sturdy, spacious.  it has two zipper compartments and several pockets. It really is a nice everyday bag.

Over the last few months have tried about 8 different purses. I wanted the quality of a dooney but didn't want to seem like I stood out. The size inside of this medium size purse is tremendous. I can fit my ipad aire in the middle zip. I can fit a one quart water bottle standing up and a full makeup regime. There is room for sunglasses, full wallet, and everything I have ever wanted to carry. I wish it had some feet but it seems with the nylon they don't do that. I love the wipe out lining vs. the regular cloth lining. I am going to order another. Also the  top snap does a good job of hiding contents inside.

I've seen questions about the authenticity of these bags, but this one looked right to me. I'm no expert on Dooney & Bourke or any other brand, however. reviewText:
Great material with super soft lining, thick enough to prevent any kind of sheerness and barely even any panty lines even though I tried them on with the "wrong" kind of underwear (cotton bikini--not what I'd normally wear under leggings since most look better with a thong or no-show cut).

Really comfy, but I'm a little worried about wearing these for long periods of time because of the fit. Granted, I have only tried them on and worn them around the house for a few hours, but it seems like these would sag in the crotch area if I were walking around any more than around my (small) apartment. The waist is pretty high, up to the bottom of my rib cage/2-3" above my belly button, and I have a long torso. They have a nice, wide waistband that doesn't cut in at all, but also doesn't help keep them in place. I ended up folding the waistband over because they came up so high, and that sort of helped reduce crotch-sag.

For reference, I'm 5'8"/125-130lbs with a 24" waist and 38" hips. I ordered the M/L because of my height, and because that was the range I definitely "should" be in. The leg length is right, if not a little on the short side (hits right above my ankle bone), but as I said the fit isn't ideal for me. Still nice and cozy for around the house on a rainy day!
summary: Great material with super soft lining

reviewText: Very warm and fits perfectly! I am 5'9 and 130 lbs. Ordered the M/L.

M/L a tight, smoothing fit and easy on the waist elastic. Very comfy. Ample stretch and not a struggle to get off and on in bathroom, etc. Crotch well seamed for comfort, no cleaving. My only wish is that they felt warmer under slacks when strolling in wintery conditions, but they do provide a degree of insulation. After one wearing I heartily recommend. We'll see how they launder and wear..,

I purchased these leggings at a discounted price to wear in the winter months of the blowing Wyoming wind. They did a great job of keeping me nice and warm while the rest of the town was freezing! I loved the fact that the material was super stretchy allowing them to fit tightly against my skin and keep me warmer (not allowing in any air between the leggings and my legs). The waist band was also thick enough to make the footless tights perfectly fitting. The footless tights proved to be true to size for me as well. I am always nervous when ordering things online, but with something like this, I think its hard for them to not work. I purchased the black pair, and they have not worn or faded on me yet. I also like that they are plenty long enough. I seem to have a hard time finding leggings and footless tights that go all the way to my ankles and these ones definitely did much to my surprise! For someone who is a little on the shorter side, they may be a little too long. I always wash these with all my other dark laundry and dry in the dryer as well. So far it has not made my leggings shrink, fray, or wear anymore than I would normally expect them to. I am happy with my purchase and this winter I would be surprised if I did not purchase these again in the rest of the colors that are available.
summary: Nice and Cozy for the winter months!

I got into the jewelry section of Amazon by mistake.  Then I could not quit looking at the pretty costume jewelry in that section.  The next thing I know I was pulling out my VISA credit card and charging it up.  My problem was not that the individual pieces I was purchasing were expensive, because they were NOT.  My problem was that I could not stop buying jewelry.  After I submitted my $800 plus order, I thought "WHAT HAVE I JUST DONE?"  I had not seen the jewelry in person, nor had I known the brands, nor had I known the quality or the size, etc., etc. and I panicked.  Well, it was done.  So, I waited for my order.  My order came in partial orders, because the jewelry was coming from different vendors / stores.  However, when the orders came in, and I opened the package and saw my jewelry.....all of it......I was so pleasantly surprised.  All of it was beautiful, great quality, fit perfectly, and priced well.  I loved everything I received, over 100 jewelry pieces, rings, earrings, necklaces, bracelets.  I wear it too.  I get compliments on all of it.  Some of the pieces are for evening wear, so I can't wear it to work.  I did not have to return a thing.  Well, that's why I work.  I work to pay my bills, but also to enjoy things I can buy.  Amazon is good about returns and refunding your money, so I wasn't too worried.  Jennifer in Houston, Texas.

This review is on the Ropalia Womens grey and orange 3pc hoodie set:
Normally a small to medium but we purchased 2XL because of the reviews.  Thank you Reviewers for your spot on reviews!  Never had a size be so far off.  Normally 2XL wouldn't stay up but these are way to tight around the waist.  Tight in legs.  The size of the waist looks like a CHILDRENS.  The sweatshirt can work if NOT to busty; seems like a small to med.  The jacket seems small to med also.

It isn't nearly as bulky as it looks.  The material isn't soft like some of the matierials today, but its substantial so it seems like it will be very warm.  The only other drawback is the jacket LINING (the orange shown in the pic) is opaque and weak.  It may RIP AWAY from grey fabric after a few washings.  No washing instructions.  No tags of any kind except one item that reads "XXL," on another item it reads "3," other item the tag is cut off.

The size of the model and her clothes size would have been very helpful.

The outfit is so cute with all three pieces together.  We would have ordered every color if the SIZING wasn't so far off and the jacket lining so thinly stiched to fabric.  There is no 3XL or 4XL to buy.  This may be good fit for kids.

Lastly, this review had nothing to do with the delivery time being lengthy because it read so before we ordered it.

reviewText:

I was able to put it back on pretty easily, and clamp it shut so it cant fall off again.  The one thing I liked was how stretchy the elastic was. We all know kids they are gonna pull, and tug on things a lot, and this elastic really stretches out. It is tied, and there is some overhang left. that I personally didn't care for, but I don't think my daughter has noticed it. So no big deal, if it is it's probably easy to snip and trim them down just a tad.
Overall: Really nice bracelet and necklace. the bow is a great added touch.

What can I say, these are my second pair of Cooltan shorts and I love them. My first pair were almost speedo-like, so I appreciate that these are shorts are a more "normal" cut so that I can feel comfortable in the pool with, even if family or friends come around (I'm not a speedo kind of guy).

I live in Arizona and spend a lot of time in the pool, so they do seem to be a lot more fragile than regular swim shorts when sitting or skimming across pebble tec, so after about two years with the other ones (of the same fabric) they started to get a little worn. To me, it is well worth it to have something that tans-through a bit and dries out super quickly when getting out of the pool. Also, the fabric is so lightweight that with the right water temperature, it feels like you almost not wearing anything, which is comfy:)
summary: these are my second pair of Cooltan shorts and I love them. My first pair were almost speedo-like

You cannot tell when you are wearing it, but I felt like one patch was centered on my elbow and one was askew, so I pulled it off and laid the sleeves side by side and saw that they were way off.  I don't know that would be the case for every one, but it was a bit disappointing.  Other than that it was perfect!

reviewText: Was pleasantly surprised with this bargain for the price pair of pants. I wore them all day and found them very comfortable. I am 5'9 1/2 inches tall and weigh 195. My usual size 16 fit perfectly. I think it is because I wear my weight around my waist. No butt but large tummy works best with a short in length top so you can see the butt and have it flow over the tummy. I bought the straight leg first and they bunched a bit at the ankle. I never wear heels or it would have been perfect. I ordered 2 more in the slight flare leg. I got them today and they are just perfect with my flats and sneakers. I haven't washed them yet but will wash as instructed. I still hang out clothes and sheets so it's no problem for me. If they come out wrinkled, I will fluff on air in the dryer and then spray with Wrinkle Free or Fabreeze. I hope they wear well. If not I will update.
summary: Great pair of pants for the money.

reviewText: These pants are awesome for work. I ordered the 14p and it fits great with 2.5 inch wedge boots. They look really professional and they are also super comfortable. I also own a pair of the ankle pants which I love!

I just received these pants in the mail and wow!  They are my favorite pants right now!  I haven't washed them yet.....but so far they fit amazingly well and are actually long enough for my 5'9" frame.  They are super slimming and very comfortable.  I'd say if you're shorter than 5'7", then they are going to be too long and you would have to hem them.  I find them to be true to my pant size.  The material is stretchy and forgiving but not saggy.  I used an iron on a low setting to get the wrinkles out, but some may not want to iron them at all.  I would say that they are mid- to high-rise, meaning when you bend over they stay on!  I work in a professional office and these would be appropriate for almost any situation, depending on how much you dress them up or down.

I waited to write a review until after I washed them. So far  I really like them!  I like that they are stretchy, and form to my shape and easy to put on. I'm 5'10 and weight 170 with wide hips and chicken legs and they fit great on me. I can never find pants that wil fit both on my hips and my chicken legs. This pants form to my hips and legs. The length is good too. I washed them in cold water and hung them to dry I did not put them in the dryer. After they dried they were wrinkled but I just out them on and they are fine I did not have to iron them. And they did not shrink probably because I didn't stick them in the dryer. I will definitely buy more in other colors.

I was mentally prepared to possibly have to send these back and order a size up or down, but when I got them, they fit like a glove.  I was impressed with how substantial the material feels - not cheap or thin or flimsy feeling.  The waist comes a little higher than I am used to, but I think they actually look better/more slimming on me for that reason.  And they are truly comfortable.  I did feel the charcoal color was just a tad darker than I had expected, but the pants ended up being the perfect shade of gray to match a gray blazer I wanted to wear with them.  Finally, I am 5'6", and at first I thought I was going to have to hem the length, but when I put the pants on with dress shoes, which have about a 1" heel, I decided that they would be fine.  But anyone shorter than me might have to hem them; anyone a few inches shorter than me might want to order the "short" size.

I do wish they had pockets (all the pockets are faux); I wore them to an all-day conference/networking event and had nowhere to stash my phone, card wallet, or business cards when I wasn't going far and didn't want to carry my purse.  I also find it a little bit difficult to tuck in a shirt without a zipper, but I guess that's part of why they are so comfortable.  I do recommend them overall though, and will probably buy them in more colors in the future.

Update: I have changed my rating from four stars to three because of how high the waist is in addition to them not having pockets.  The high waist line is visible through slinky, loosely form-fitting shirts, and many of my shirts don't look good tucked in either.  The kind of shirt that looks best is the kind that's loose with an elastic bottom.  The point is these pants haven't turned out to be as versatile as I'd hoped. :/
summary: Wish they had pockets and a lower waistline

reviewText: So I originally wanted to give this 5 stars for sure - looked amazing and held its shape all through the day!  But then I hand washed them.  And they are so wrinkled that they are not salvageable.  It sucks.

reviewText: I ordered a pair of the indigo size 12R. fit OK, a little loose  & too long, considering i'm only 5'1 & on the thicker side. I ordered a second pair in the color " Silver" in a size 10S and those fit better, still too long for me. Short people problems. Overall, the pants fit well, they stretch with you. I found the indigo pants to be scratchier than the silver ones. Silver ones are soft (picture is true to color) and comfy to wear for a longer period of time; indigo were uncomfortable after a couple of hours. There is some stretch in the waist but not a whole lot, definitely recommend you take your  measurements before you pick a size so you don't end with pants that are too snug or too loose. I plan on ordering more in different colors now that I know a 10S fits best.

The only thing I could think that I would do differently if I could design a ring myself would be to add a little something on the side under the main setting, like a little bezel set sapphire. But I am very happy with this ring!

Update....
Within a few days of wearing the ring I noticed that it had a loose stone. I didn't want to send it back to have it replaced because it already had sentimental value so I paid out of pocket to have it fixed. A few weeks later another stone was loose. I contacted the company about it and they were little to no help. So I ended up paying out of my pocket AGAIN to have it fixed and make sure that the last stone was in there tight. Very disappointed with the quality and customer service about this issue. Don't buy from them!
summary: Pretty ring but it had a loose stone

Look also at the return situation. Unless you want to pay to return it overseas, do not order. Attached photograph shows this shirt atop a new medium shirt and a bust measurement of 34" which equates to a small (33-35"), not a medium (36-38") or a large (39-40").

reviewText:
We would give it a 4.5 stars if we could.

I debated between keeping this one or the ebags weekender junior, and decided that the weekender junior was the keeper, even though I would totally go with this bag in a heart beat if it were more ergonomic.

As you can see in the photo, I packed in quite a bit of stuff to test its capacity. It's what I'm bringing for a mountain getaway of 3 days and 2 nights in Taiwan. The main compartment was packed full with the clothing and the Bluetooth speaker. The back is where I put the tablet, though I wish there is actually a padded compartment for it.

Pro:
Excellent built quality - the bag is as thick and well-built and beautiful in person as it is in the photo.
The various compartments were perfect for my organization of the trip.
The zippers seemed to be of good quality.
Packing was easy because the sides of the main compartment was very sturdy and stout.
It's light-weight: 2 pounds! Even with the bag filled full, it did not feel heavy when I lifted it.
The paddings on the back are super comfortable, and the straps are very well-built!

Con:
I hate that I must undo the top handle buttons in order to access any of my larger compartments.
The weight of the packed bag pulls from my shoulder and back - chest and waist straps would solve that problem. If this bag had those, I'd keep it, hands down. Otherwise, I know it will be painful once I have to deal with it during long walks through the city and mountains.

I could probably fit a foldable hairdryer in there but I don't have one right now - I plan on buying one soon.

Conclusion? It's beautifully made - a very sexy bag. It'd be perfect for a weekend trip, but if you plan on walking a lot, this may not be for you as it will hurt your back.
summary: Perfect size for a weekend, but not ergonomic

reviewText: This suit is perfect for me. The clues se just as pictured

A backpacker's dream! At only 1.1lbs., this is a well constructed, ultralight rectangular bag. In October I asked if they could be zipped together and another reviewer answered me "yes". Threes months after posting the question, I  purchased  two to zip together and use as a double bag in my 68 vw camper bus as bedding. However, the ends of the zipper feeds into the fabric and is not possible.  Although they do not, Aegis chose to not correct the wrong answer given, even after 3 months.  Hence the 4, rather than 5 star rating.
  Even though I can not use them as I intended, I chose to keep them to use for backpacking. I have been using them in my hammock outside almost every day since they arrived. I absolutely love the versatility of having two bags. I can use one as an under quilt or stuff one inside the other for use as a colder weather bag, and they still feel roomy when used this way.  The fabric is soft and I just love the color- not army green or primary colors like most of the better bags out there. If you happen to let them hit the ground, the leaves and forest debris will not stick to the fabric- easy to keep clean on a hike. They fluff out with a simple shake. I am 6'0", 145lbs and I fit completely inside- lying down straight the fabric reaches above my face, and I do not feel constricted at all.
  So backpackers and hikers, if you're looking for a ultralight, rectangular, summer bag, you'll be a happy camper. But if you're shopping for
rectangular bags you can combine for a double, keep looking.
summary: A Backpacker's Dream! But beware they DO NOT ZIP TOGETHER!!!

Wonderful dress!  Bought it for a seven day Caribbean Cruise, paired with some colorful kimonos, I plan wearing it for a few dressy dinners. I'm confident this dress will wash easily in the cabin shower and be dry in time for the following evening's dinner.  I have no doubt I'll get a lot of wear out of it next summer too.  Thanks!

UPDATE

We have returned home from our cruise, had a lovely time. I'm a roll packer, so this dress traveled from Ohio to Belize in a tight roll, and back like a CHAMP! When we got on the cruise, I simply unrolled it, spritzed it with some wrinkle reducer and it was ready for dinner only a few hours later. While on our trip, I did wash the dress once while in the shower, squeezed it out good then rolled it in a towel and stepped on it a bit. Then I hung the dress out on the balcony for a nighttime drying (after all, you're usually sailing at night and in the middle of the ocean, so who's around to complain?), and it was COMPLETELY dry by morning.

I will DEFINATELY buying another for later travels!

reviewText: These are HUGE and don't come smaller than small but I still love them because they comfortable and have Rainbow Dash all over them. They look like the picture and seem to be at least as sturdy as the typical canvas shoe.

I really love these shoes, just received them in the mail! However, they don't quite fit. I ordered the regular small because I'm usually a 6.5-7 in shoes depending on the brand. These are a bit large for me, like half a shoe size to even a shoe size too big. I had my grandmother try it on to see how it fit (she's a 7.5) and she said it was tight. Either I'm more of a 6.5 according to this shoe or it's just made not for my foot shape. For the price I will keep them because I really love them; Rainbow Dash is my favorite pony and these shoes are comfortable. I put a Dr. Scholl's in it to take up some space and am keeping the tissue that the shoe came with inside the shoes to fill up the end so that my feet don't fall out. Without socks my feet are coming up and out of the shoe constantly, and with socks they still didn't fit so that has been my solution. I wish the sizes that were listed were more true to themselves and a little more detailed as to what shoe size they fit. I chose the Small over the Small (7-8), but now I wonder if I should've gone with that size. Only get this shoe size if you know you're a 7 or 7.5 in shoes normally, not someone who fluctuates solely based on brand between 7 and 6.5 because it didn't fit me. The video in my review shoes me first trying on a shoe as is and showing that when I walk it comes off and doesn't fit. Then I show the second shoe and the amendments I made to it to make it fit, and show me walking in it and it not slipping off. The colors are great, the shoes came in great condition, but the sizing was too big for me without mending them myself.

My daughter is six and has learned to be more careful with her shoes, but it would sure be nice if she didn't have to walk on eggshells with these boots. If they were more resistant to scuffing, I'd recommend them to anyone. Its more of a "bat shape" fit and if your body type is a little broader then it seems to accentuate that shape more so. I was hoping for kind of a casual no thought put into it kind of look and I find myself feeling rather "large" and uncomfortable in it. It's made of a softer yarn? And feels nice against the skin but I do recommend a tank or t-shirt b worn under it. Finally although nice it doesn't seem like it's nicely made (if that makes sense). I have only hand washed it (in cold water) and lay it out to dry and even with extreme care it seems to easily unravel and after maybe 3 washes it looks pretty shabby. I don't hate the purchase I just wish I would have gotten it for much less then what I paid for it so it didn't feel like I wasted my money.

The fit was great, I ordered a medium which is my normal clothing size and it did fit me correctly. I also thought the material of everything was good- better than a many costumes I've bought in the past. Could see this being worn more than once, unlike some costumes- which was a big plus for me!

The things that did bother me were the size of the bandana. I definitely have a normal sized head but this bandana was not a full sized bandana, I couldn't use it because it was just too small. I sort of jerry-rigged it to barely function but just ended up taking it off before my day was over.

Besides that, I did feel like the neckline was A LOT lower than pictured. I chalked it up to having a smaller chest than the model but double sided tape was definitely needed in order to conceal my bra. It just seemed like it sat a lot wider and deeper than what is pictured on the model.

I was also tricked by the sleeves. I zoomed in multiple times mulling over my options before deciding to buy this costume and not once did I realize that the sleeves are rolled up in the picture. So, if you're expecting a 3/4 length sleeve like I was, be warned the sleeves are full, long sleeves. Not a big deal to me, but not what I was expecting. I honestly thought they were 3/4 length and cuffed.

reviewText:
ok, so here is the deal with all sweater tights that show asian sizing.

for US byers:
despite matching up your measurements with their charts your body type is not factored in.  Proportions of US women (meaning all our various genetic traits that we physically show) are no where close to those of asian culture peoples.  Our inseam is longer so most of these sweater tights will not fit most of us as intended.  If you are a petite US or asian culture woman then you will most likely be able to enjoy the fit of these types of tights.  For the rest of us who are not petite but a normal (meaning h/wt proportionate) for our heights will find these types of tights to be very short in the inseam/crotch area but fit in other respects.  some of these (for example; footless variations like the ones seen here) tights can be manipulated to be worn by pulling them up short to fit the crotch area but there are other trade-offs for doing so.  If you're like me and really like the idea of sweater tights; footless or footed you'll need to get over the idea of "saving a ton of money" when you see these listed in places like ebay or amazon for under $8  when you really want something like this to fit the way its designed to fit.  Instead, you'll need to "suck it up" and expect to pay a bit more for sweater tight that fit as advertised; brands like HUE etc.  the best thing you can do is go to your local dept store and try on some various brands as some fit better than others.  If pricing is still an issue after trying on you can often times go to the manufacturer website and order direct.  Otherwise you'll find yourself like me, wearing a pair like the ones seen here and ordered for less than $5 but pulled up so high they are no longer heeled/toe-less sweater tights but instead capris that do fit, snuggly and no doubt stretching this very durable material to what I estimate is its max threshold, with a hole where the heel would have sat had they fit as advertised for a US woman body.  I think if they didn't have that long-john underwear U on the seat they might actually fit as advertised for most US women.  in summation, if you are not a petite woman of any nationality avoid this product and others like it, instead buy what you know fits from having tried them on at a dept store near you.  you'll save yourself a lot of disappointment and frustration with overseas sellers who really don't understand why their product isn't working for US buyers.  If you purchased these tights and they don't fit consider making your own long sock or over the knee sock out of them as most of them do not roll down and if they do you're still trendy as slouchy socks are in too!  of course you can gift them but why when you can still use them as the re-purposed sock that is custom made to the length you need for your socks.

if money is still a concern you can try buying off season like I did.  Most dept stores start season resets earlier and earlier so I was able to find several pairs of thermal tights that fit in addition to finding sweater tights that fit.  Also, there is a difference between sweater and knit tights.  knit tights are more of a thick nylon hosiery where sweater tights are indeed thicker than nylon but very stretchy and very much a textile instead of nylon hosiery.
summary: Buy sweater tight brands you know fit from having tried them on first.  Don't gift due to bad fit but cut for over the knee sock

reviewText: Bought a larger size but the coat is great.

Ok guys and girls. Just received the coat in the mail and wanted to give an honest to goodness fair review of this coat. Before I purchased this coat I made sure to read the reviews before I went all in. As stated this coat runs extremely small. I am a small build female so I decided to take my chances with a medium coat. When I first pulled it out of the bag I said to myself, nope, that's never going to fit me. Disappointed with the way it looked not to fit, I didn't try it on. After about an hour of sulking I decided what do I have to loose. Well, it fit...but it fit like it was tailored. Not that tailored is bad but with a coat you like a little wiggle room. Wearing this with a fine dress will look amazing. Now it was shorter than it looks in the picture. It comes to the middle of my shin and I am short...about 5'2 and about 107 pounds. The coat was a little thinner than I expected and the black trim is not solid like I thought. The black trim is lace like...not bad...just not what I was expecting. The biggest thing I can tell everyone about this coat is that if your not a small frame female...and I mean small frame...this coat will not fit you. I got extremely lucky I didn't have to return this coat.
summary: An honest review from someone who bought it.

This hat is so cute. If I'm being honest I would probably wear this hat myself. But I'm never that cold. I live in a climate with 2 basic seasons, hot and scorching.  To my children that get up and leave the house bright and early for school, if it's not scorching it's cold. So I figured my girls would get some use out of this hat.  My six year old is very eccentric and likes to stand out so I figured this would be perfect for her. Besides she is my animal lover. So I gave it to her and she gasped with excitement, literally. She put on the hat and could not stop playing with the braided strings.  She was outside playing and the hat stayed in place. I can see it's a little big but it's not floppy or sloppy looking.

The hat i very well made and the material was thicker than I expected. The cool kitty on the front is not a sticker or something that will fall off over time. It's part of the material so it's there to stay. The braids have frayed bottoms but there is a knot to stop the frays from raveling up the braid.  Although the material is thick the hat is lightweight. The fact that the inside is lined with a soft felt material helps keep my daughter's head extra warm. Over all I'm very pleased with the look and quality of this hat. I love all the different styles available!
I received this product complimentary in exchange for my honest opinion but the opinion expressed is all my own.

I'm sort of a big guy, and for some reason, I ignored the "Slim Fit" part of the description. Well, no, I didn't truly ignore it, I just thought I could get past it by ordering a larger size.

I have an American leather jacket size Large, and it fits me a little on the loose side. I figured I could go for the equivalent of a Large, so I ordered THIS product's XXL. The shipping was great, came in the mail just when it said it would, and the packaging didn't leave anything to be desired. It's just a bit too snug, however.

That is the general idea of the "Slim Fit" style, though. As for the length, this jacket will not go past the waistline of your pants, which is strange considering it's meant to be worn on a motorcycle (you're in a prone position). Ah well. So let's get past the sizing topic and onto the quality of the jacket.

It's a bit noisy, like sitting on leather furniture. The zippers don't look the most durable, BUT, I'm sure they'll do the job just fine. I am a little curious about the pockets - they zip closed to keep with the slim shape, but they're very difficult to access. It's awkward for me because I'm so used to putting my hands in the two side pockets of my coat. I really like the epaulets - they don't poke up too tall, and they're very fashionable.

I really really like this jacket despite its flaws, I just wish I could wear it.

This is a great jacket especially for the price. It is light and does not have a full zip-closure, but has a satin lining and the plaid is a soft fleece. Since I live in California this will be all I need for Fall/Winter, although I don't plan to use it in rain. As for fit, I am 5'2", 120lbs and bought a medium. The fit is perfect on my body. The length falls to my mid-thighs, so it will keep my entire torso covered and warm. The sleeves are a little short, which might be a problem for some people, especially if short-sleeves are a common issue for you. For me however I ALWAYS have the problem of too-long sleeves so these nice short ones are welcomed. I can move around in the jacket and the sleeves don't get in the way. Overall its a nice sturdy coat for my size & style and especially for my climate. I definitely wouldn't recommend this as a warm coat for a cold-climate, you might only get about a months use of wear anywhere it snows.

We ordered this in the 12-18-month size for a wedding for our son who had just turned one. It was an evening wedding and past his bedtime, so we specifically wanted something that we could just put him straight to bed in when we got back to the hotel. It worked perfectly for what we wanted and looked quite cute. It's as comfortable as any onsie outfit but manages to look like a suit. Our son is right at the 50th percentile mark for height and weight, and it just barely fit to snap up at the crotch, so I strongly recommend buying a size up for an averaged sized kid. When he had his 15-month growth spurt he no longer fit in it, and I have seen others mention the size is small. The pants didn't go to the ankle, but I'm not sure if that's a style thing or just a sizing issue. He still received many "cute" and "adorable" comments, so that isn't a big issue to me. If you do buy a larger size, you'll likely have to roll the sleeves a bit, as they were almost long. The only real problem for us we had was keeping the bow in place. I'd recommend taking a needle and thread to it to quick-stitch it in place, as it slips out easily. It went through the washer and dryer a few times without problems or noticeable shrinking (he outgrew it pretty quickly, so we only washed it two or three times).  We ordered it a month in advance, as the possible shipping time was fairly long when we bought it. It came in plenty of time. The price was better than most outfits for kids this age.

Is it fancy? No.
Is it cute? In my opinion, absolutely!
Will a person wanting something that looks expensive like it? No, you don't get expensive-looking at this price unless something is on sale.
Would I buy it again? Yes, but in a larger size and early enough that I don't have to sweat the delivery time.

Overall, I was quite pleased with it and am glad I didn't spend mountains of money on a suit for a wedding.
summary: Cute, very inexpensive, not fancy, just a bit small on sizing.

I am 5'3" with a size 36DD bust and I ordered a size XL in this shirt based on the size chart. While the XL isn't too big on me, I think I actually could have easily fit into the L size of this shirt. That aside, I have to tell you that I really love everything about this shirt. The fabric is so soft and comfortable that I found myself just touching it while I was wearing it simply because it felt so nice. The shirt is a great Sumner weight - very light and airy and nothing feels constricting or binding. The neckline is very comfortable and modest so the top can really go just about anywhere - even to work with a pair of dress slacks and heels. I found it to be very versatile - it also looks great with jeans or shorts and it washes well. It comes out of the dryer looking great with no shrinkage or seam shredding. For the price, this is an excellent addition to your wardrobe. I did receive this product for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion.

I just love this blouse. I don't often order clothes online because I like to see how they are going to fit, first. But this flowy circle blouse looked comfortable, so I decided to try it. It arrived much sooner than promised, so that was a bonus. But the fact that this blouse is absolutely one of the most perfect t-shirts/blouse pieces I've ever bought is what's best. First, it came true to size. I ordered an x-large and it fits perfectly. Next, the material is soft and ultra-comfortable, and it does flow, just like it says in the ad. Third, I like that it does this without showing your underwear under your arms. So many times you sacrifice your bodesty to get blouses like this. But with this top, modesty isn't a problem. It's really cool how your arms have freedom to move, the blouse is flowy, and it just feels beautiful. Last but not least, I like how it sits on my hips. It's not too short, and not too long, and the way it's made makes it look like it was fitted just for me. I like it. I received a sample of this product at a discount for my honest unbiased review.

This tank top is very lightweight and comfortable. It is made of a stretchy material and it fits true to size. I like the lightweight material because it makes it even more comfortable in the summer when it is really hot. The tank top is made of high quality materials and I think that it will last a long time. All seams are intact and it just seems made very well. The straps are about an inch wide, I think that they are the perfect width. The only thing that I didn't like is that you can slightly see through it. I really like wearing it at home, even sometimes when I workout because of the lightweight material. However, if I go out I like to wear a tank top under it.  Its great to layer with other tops as well. I really like the color that I picked out, I think that it is a very pretty and vibrant color. I chose this color because I don't have many shirts of this color. I think that the tank top does look really cute and I would recommend this tank top to other people.

reviewText: It great as an undergarment.

I am a HUGE tank top person -- especially in the summer.  I sleep in tank tops and I wear a tank top practically every day.  So I guess I would call myself a Tank Top Expert -- if there was such a thing.  I absolutely love this tank top. It is so soft and comfy -- I would wear it every day if I could.

There are several things that I really like about this tank top. It is super soft -- you can tell that it is ringspun cotton vs the standard cotton. Being ringspun makes it super soft.  I also really like that it is made with a little bit of spandex because I like my tanks to fit naturally. I also really like that this is a longer tank -- it drives me nuts when my tanks ride up over my belly -- really, who wants to see that? This really fits and feels great.

The only thing that I don't like is that the tag is a bit itchy and scratchy.  There are two sewn in tags on the neckline -- one for the brand and one for care instructions.  After reading the instructions on how to wash and care for this fabric I simply cut both tags out - problem solved.  I would prefer sewn in tags to be on the side seam but that is just my personal preference.  Overall this is a great tank and I would buy one in every color if I could.  Also, I don't know why the description states this is ribbed because the material is smooth and doesn't have a ribbed texture -- you can see how smooth the material is when you zoom in on the listing picture.

I really like this tank top and would highly recommend it. I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review. Like you, I use reviews to make purchases through Amazon so I've provided a review that is truthful and completely honest as if I paid full price for the product.
summary: As a "Tank Top Expert"  -- I Love This Tank.  Very Lightweight, Soft and Comfortable

These are the best fleece pajamas!  We live in a cooler climate so our 19 month daughter wears these year round.  She is a little on the taller side (80% percentile), so she has been wearing the 2T for the past 2-3 months.  She'll likely outgrow the 2T in the next couple of months.  Here are the top reasons why I prefer these fleece pajamas to the other major brands that we've tried.

- Very soft.  A lot softer compared to other brands.
- Reasonably priced.
- Super cute patterns and colors.
- Don't shrink much.  We throw them in the dryer and while they might have shrunk a tiny bit on the first dry, they don't progressively get smaller like other brand have.
- We can find them year round on Amazon, versus other brands are very difficult to find in the summer.

reviewText:
Despite  the negative comments, I decided to try this product out for myself.
First, there is an error in the description; it doesn't clip to the top of one's socks but rather, each of the two shirt stays has an elasticized loop which can go under the foot or around the leg.  I chose the latter.  Each lightweight strap goes up where it splits into two separate straps like a "y" which each has a button slide on the end.  This is actually much easier than it sounds, I am just trying to paint a picture with words.  You slide the button out and then back in with the shirt over the slide button,--- it is very easy.  However, you must use a little pressure to slide the button all the way back in so that it won't slip back out.
The adjustable slide metal tab is certainly functional.  You flip it up, slide the strap to whatever length suits your leg length and flip it securely back into place.
I also suggest attaching them to your shirt before putting it on.
At first, I was reluctant to purchase because of the other two reviews but decided to determine for myself.  I am glad that I did.
$24.99 for the pair is a bit pricey but I like my shirt stays.  They function very effectively for their intended purpose.
There is no adjusting the height.  The little silver braces might as well just not have been made.

This review is for the Deer Mum Ladies Denim Jean Campagne Bling USA/Other Characters Pattern Adjustable Baseball Cap. I absolutely love the idea and the design behind this hat, but there are a few flaws in this one that need to be pointed out. Do not get me wrong it is a great buy for the price, but it still does have a few issues. So this cap is made of denim. It has a distressed design to it with the tears in the bill of the hat, which are super cute. There is a red pattern underneath the tears, which makes it look really cute. The USA on the hat are actually iron on black patches of material that have the rhinestones hot glued on. You can see the glue trails on and around the stones and hat. The black material is lifting around some of the edges just a little, but that little bit can easily turn into a lot later when this happens. The stones are dull. I am not sure if this is on purpose or they are just worn. They are not stones either, sorry about that, they are plastic stone like pieces, which is fine with me. The hat does look super cute but those are items that you might want a little more detail on. The part that concerns me is the adjustable strap on the back of the hat. It is a thinner faux leather type material that really looks like it will tear or break easily. I have adjusted it to my head and do not plan on messing with that part in the future if I can help it. Overall is really is a super cute hat. Just be aware of those details before deciding to purchase. I only plan to wear this one a few times a year so it is perfect for me. I received this hat at a discounted price to give my honest review and this is my honest review of the Deer Mum Ladies Denim Jean Campagne Bling USA/Other Characters Pattern Adjustable Baseball Cap .
summary: I absolutely love the idea and the design behind this hat

reviewText:
Bought this for my fiance because she was complaining about not having sexy nightgowns to wear.  Was a little skeptical, since it ships straight from Hong Kong.  It arrived in a timely manner give it was shipped halfway across the world.

Positives:  Absolutely can not complain about the price.  The quality of materials is good.  She said the lace top isn't itchy which I've learned over the years from her, is actually a thing, who knew.  The satin part has only gotten softer with time.  When we first received the nightie, it had that China factory smell to it, can't describe it, but if you've ordered clothing from china, you know what I'm talking about.  We were very gentle with it at first, hand washing and hang drying to ensure it doesn't get destroyed.  The first wash is a hand wash must, there appeared to be a ton of excess dye that bled out of it into the water the first wash, and continued for a few more after that.  Eventually, we got lazy and decided to machine was it, given that if it was destroyed, we could order a new one.  The babydoll has survived numerous rounds through the washer and dryer, and hasn't fallen apart.  She actually asked me to buy a second one for her friend, never heard if her friend liked it or not.  Quality babydoll, and unlike other cheap lingerie on amazon, this one actually impressed me.
summary: The quality of materials is good. She said the lace top isn't itchy which ...
