reviewText:
Sizing
--------------------------------------
Just like everyone else says, it's really oddly shaped.  In no way is this a "slim fit" sweatshirt.  I've purchases some other similarly styled products and most aren't as extreme as this.  I'm 5'7" and 180 lbs without any gut and have large arms so I went with the XL (US large) based on reviews of others, even though I usually wear a US medium.

The arm length was pretty much perfect, as was the shoulder width.  The length of the body was slightly longer than expected, but not by much.  Having larger than usual arms for someone my size, I expected them to fit a little on the tighter side.  They were a bit tighter than would normally be expected from a US medium, which means they were very small for a US large equivalent.  Despite the reasonable length of the body, the girth was ridiculously large.  Despite being a US large equivalent, the girth of the body would be on the large side for a US X-large.

Overall fit is slim-fit US medium arms attached to a relaxed fit US X-large body with US medium sized shoulder width.

Construction
-------------------------
I've purchased other products with a similar fit and branding, but this is probably the shoddiest construction I've seen.  The material is warm but not very durable, and the zippers are cheap plastic.  Only the zipper pull is made of metal, the block at the bottom of the zipper is extra cheap plastic.  The shoulder seams are very terrible design, not being patterned like a normal shirt or sweatshirt but having a folded corner.  With the low quality shoulder seam design it looks forever like you're trying to hide small horns growing out of the top of your shoulders.

Misc
--------------------------
There are 3 zippers other than the main one on this sweatshirt, and two of them go to pockets (there's no breast pocket).  The pockets are pretty decent sized, and because the material is on the thinner side they don't really add additional bulk to the sweatshirt.  The zippers are made of the same zipper material as the main one (terrible low quality), but they do have stops on them so you can't completely unzip them accidentally and be unable to zip them closed again.  The problem is that while the pockets are rather large, the whole to get into them is really tiny.  I don't have particularly large hands for a 5'7" guy, but I can only get 3 fingers into the pocket opening.  The pockets being large actually means they're useless to me since my three fingers can't reach anything I might have put in the pockets.  If you had miniscule hands you might be able to get your whole hand in one of these pockets, but that's it.
summary: Not slim-fit, gigantic fat-fit with tiny arms. Low quality construction too.

reviewText: If we weren't so desperate for a long black wig, we would have returned this one. It is thin (not dense) and it tangles something awful. The good news is that it did not get fuzzy after the first use. We've had other wigs that immediately get fuzzy. The hair is still smooth but it just tangles instantaneously.

I really enjoyed this wig.  I used it for my princess bubble gum costume for Halloween. Good price for the quality. It was very difficult to keep it from tangling, especially since I have kids, but if you don't have kids it would probably be easier to keep it looking fresh. I had to clip the bangs back because they would not stay out of my eyes lol. It needed some light grooming when it came out of the pack, as would be expected. It took a few weeks to arrive in the mail, so plan ahead :)
summary: Good wig, good price. Tangly but nice.

reviewText: Awful wig. I have been buying and styling wigs for 5 years, this is one of the worst of quality I've ever bought. The cap on the inside of it was made out of netting, a obvious sign of a cheap wig. The same material that you could find in a Party City or other costume stores. I've bought others with lace cap and made out of better fibers from amazon. I would not recommend this wig, I'm now reluctant about the seller as well. Because of this, I think I'll just stick to ARDA wigs from now on.
summary: this is one of the worst of quality I've ever bought

reviewText: Be careful buying wigs on here! You definitely get what you pay for. Wig looks nothing like in photo. It's long, greasy-looking, and you'll have to cut the bangs yourself. Hard to comb, tangles easily. It doesn't look silky/smooth at all. I couldn't even work with the hair because overally it's cheap material, and it's sewn very cheaply. I just ended up trashing it.
summary: You get what you pay for

reviewText: When I got it it was a little tight but not a big deal. To wash it I use baby shampoo let it soak in luke warm water for about 20 mins. Gently pat down with a towel. Use a wig brush/wide tooth comb, let it air dry, brush from the bottom to the top gently. If you start at the top you will only tangle the hair more. For me, I use a little tea tree stimulating growth oil and some jamaican black castor oil and Ganier Fructis Heal and Seal Treatment to help a bit, you only need a little if you want to use these that is, and I ran my fingers through the wig. I let it hang on the door for a few hours and, every now and then brush it and once fully dryed. Use flat irons on a safe setting lets say 350. You don't want it too too hot, it will melt. Then finish it off with light hair spray. I use to work at a beauty supply store, and dealt with a lot of wigs. You can use your own methods, this one worked for me. Also if your unsure, use Youtube. Enjoy <3
Looks like real human hair. You need to store it on a mannequin head.  Very nice.

Don't buy if you need to part down the middle! I bought this for a cosplay but I need it to part down the middle and this wig does not do that. It is gorgeous otherwise, I just wish I would have known.
summary: Don't buy if you need it to part in the middle!

I placed the order on jan 8th, and it just came today, feb 16, which was anticipated. I really do like this sweatshirt, a lot. It fits loosely, and it's very comfortable, but I would recommend it only from a fashion aspect as it's pretty thin. I see myself wearing this a lot. I was worried that it might have been too bright and eye catching, which I didn't want particularly, but I can see now that it's actually printed on the fabric rather than a graphic transfer so I also don't have to worry about the pattern eventually peeling off. The only thing that I wasn't expecting, which you probably can't see in the photo, is that there is a mesh strip on either side of the pattern that extends up to the fabric for the arms and hood, and it's only on the front side. I actually think it helps the sweater hang more naturally without being too poofy. The arms could be a little longer, but I am 6'1 so I wasn't expecting to have a perfect fit so anyone shorter, it fit perfectly.
summary: I really do like this sweatshirt

I've been having more and more trouble with achy hands in the winter and they seem to be getting worse with bad circulation, etc. But you can't type with gloves on and my work takes a lot of time on the keyboard. These gloves are perfect and fit me well. I have small hands and they are as if they were made for me.  A lot of buyers seem to be griping about threads pulling, etc. Since these are partially polyester or something, I simply took my trusty lighter and burned all the ends of the finger holes lightly and any pulled threads were reduced to little melted balls of poly which I quickly mashed into the pile.  A tailor's trick for socks and works very well on these gloves, no more pulled threads or frayed ends. (Remember to just melt the outside edges, the inside needs to stay soft.)
summary: Great For Arthritus Sufferers in the Winter

Bought these for my wife.  This has the fingers cut and thought these would be a good touch to have the fingers out.  Well....she took these off in the cold and the cut-off fingers somehow pulled her diamond ring off and the ring unbeknownst to us dropped onto the wet cold side walk in a little sleepy mountain town. Unsuspecting, we drove miles back to our place, got ready for bed, half asleep I hear her question where her ring is after she left the bathroom. We searched the entire room, drains, hallway, lobby, car than thought, what if it is back in town somewhere?  We frantically drove into the rainy little town with the windshield wipers blazing. With a flash light I peered through the locked windows and doors of all the shops and restaurants we visited that night. No luck. After 30 mins,  I than said lets retrace the walk back to the car from earlier. There and behold, in the middle of the dark, wet side walk, half glimmering in the puddle of the cobble stone sidewalk...  My flash light picked up a sparkle just edging out of the crevice of rain water. I froze in relief. There it was, in the middle of the sidewalk, in a puddle at a little small town intersection! We still thank the powers to be...unreal!!!!  What are the odds. Moral of the story, if you buy these gloves buy a massive diamond that you can see on the side walk because it will fall off!
summary: Buy these gloves but not a diamond ring...or visa versa

reviewText: So stinkin cute!  Great service!

Great quality.  Great price.  This is labelled as a boxer brief.  In reality, it is a brief.  It fits well and is the perfect suit if you do not want a bikini or a boxer brief style.  The front pouch and rear center seam add comfort as well as great styling.  Something for everyone.

*EDIT*
The following part was true when it was written, but now the seller sizes up for you like everyone else.  I'm going to leave what I wrote before though because it may still give insight on fit...  And I am, in fact, ordering more.  That's how I discovered the sizing change...  :-)
And I'm also happy to report that they've worn very well, meaning that they fit great (albeit a little snug, as you'll learn from my following review) and they have held together admirably.  (Especially considering that this particular pair is stretched a little bit more than usual!)
*The following is my original review*

These are awesome, let me just start with that.  The material feels great, and the cut is done nicely.  I'll be ordering more, for sure.

When I do though, I'll pay more attention, and you should as well.  Some underwear sellers tell you to order your regular size and they will size-up for you.  (You order small and they will send you Medium, because it's labeled Asian size and their medium is our small).  Other sellers tell YOU to order one bigger.  That's the case here.  I wear small, so I ordered small.  I got SMALL.  And they kinda really are...!!  (Even for my 29" waist)  *sigh*... Lol
I can get them on without it feeling like I'm constricting anything, but I'm going to be ordering a couple more pairs in a size Medium.  :-)

**second EDIT**  The size medium pair showed up a few weeks ago and they're perfect.  Form-fitting without squeezing stuff.  I'm definitely happy with them!
summary: Pay attention to the size you order!

The only thing I have noticed, is on some the neck is too low and when bending over gives up a nice show.  Others, the neckline is higher up, and is perfect for me.  I highly recommend these shirts.

This jacket is a great addition to my winter coat collection.  It is an excellent fit and is VERY warm.  It is well made and looks more expensive than what I paid for it.  The only issue I had with it was that it took over three weeks to receive.  I wasn't aware that this was going to be made and shipped from China.  The package as well as the tag on the jacket are written in Chinese. The other odd thing is that the jacket came in a medium,  instead of an XS that I ordered, even though I believe it is actually an extra small, at least in comparison to clothing sizes in the U.S.  There is no possible way that anyone wearing an medium, at least to U.S. standards would ever be able to fit in it.  Being that most asian women are smaller, I assume their idea of what a medium is in comparison to what we wear is most likely different.  If it were any smaller on me, I would have had to return it.  Anyhow, all I really care about is that I received an appropriately fitting jacket.

reviewText:
I have been buying a lot of underwear the past few months. The standard cotton briefs (Hanes, FotL, I'm talking to you) do not satisfy me anymore. I needed something more (or less). Lately, I find myself wanting to go commando (for the breathability you see), but I really don't like the idea of having my butt cheeks rubbing against the jean fabric. I tried suspensory jockstraps, but the backside openess was less than desired. I searched and found these O-pouch low rise briefs, and OH! is right.
The photo displays a pack of 7, which is inexpensive and covers the whole week for not a lot of money. Each pair came wrapped in its own little pouch. The fabric is a breathable mesh that is airy without being drafty. I wear a 34" inseam, and ordered the XL (US Large) and the fit is superb. Now, the OH. The front flap flips up to reveal a circle through which the whole team shines. I put these on, and I feel like I am wearing nothing. They are just what I wanted in an underwear to go quasi-commando. I don't even feel the elastic in the legs. They fit just below the navel, so that when I wear my Old Navy jeans, I don't have to worry about feeling my briefs (yeah, I'm still looking at you Hanes).
I am happy with this purchase. I now have two favorites. The David Archy micromodal separate pouch, for when I am feeling a little bit naughty, and these, for when I wanna "rock out with my..." (you know the rest). I think on a couple of pair, I will just remove the front pouch altogether and let my love show through my jeans.
An extra large is way too small.
summary: If you order, order two or three sizes larger than usual.

reviewText: great boxer Vpouch I love the way it fit me.

Wish the waist band were a little stronger or wider.  I think they were recommended to be ordered a size up due to the Asian sizing.  I'm at the largest end of the small size in US sizing and sometimes it's really true to go a size up.  But, in this case, compared small and medium and found the small to fit better.  Breath nice, don't stay damp long after being wet, give good support.  Expect a little "wedgy" feeling out back.... but not overly invasive like a full on thong. Just enough to keep the contours of the cheeks.  One nice thing is the loser leg holes which otherwise would tend to ride up and bunch on the boxer style like this.  Could probably pass as swim trunks in a pinch.  A nice feature if you live where it gets really hot and impromptu trips to a local swimming hole arise now and again.  Found a 7 pack by this seller for a better price. These are made by WangJiang, which offers MANY style of underwear.

reviewText: These are made with a super fine mesh material that is very smooth and silky next to the skin, very comfortable to wear with nice stretch to the fabric.  Very low rise and nice pouch with good support, not undersized like some foreign products of this nature, and a little cheeky in the back.  I wear size 33 and 34 pants so ordered these in Size L and the resulting fit is about perfect.  So, seller's sizing instructions to order up one size over your normal US sizing is correct in my opinion and will provide for a good fit.  Overall construction appears quite good, but have not been through washing(s) yet so can't absolutely testify to durability.  But for the price you can't go wrong with this product.  Like well enought to order more.

Bought the absolute largest they had - XL. Sizing chart shows this for Men's waists from 40" to 43". My waist is 34". The pants really don't fit; barely fit at the waist; I have to (painfully) stretch into them. Seriously, these pants must be made for emaciated small people with spindly legs. They are also too short. Unfortunately, they don't make anything larger. My suggestion is to buy 4 sizes larger than what you normally wear; and if they don't have it - don't buy it. The padding is bunched up because the pattern or cut is cheap. The fabric on the front half of the legs is windproof. The fabric on the back allows 'breathing'. This would be a good idea if you were always moving at 15mph or greater and never have a tail wind. Aside from these issues, they are great.

I loved this bag right when I got it, although the light brown parts were a little more orange-y in person. I planned to use this as an alternative to a handbag and wanted something semi-professional looking so I could take it into work. However, I have only had this bag for less than one month and have two issues with it. The first issue is that the leather has begun to tear down where the straps meet (see pic) on both sides. I typically carry a small wallet, two sets of keys, and a cell phone in it. I do not use this for heavy items, so I am disappointed that it is beginning to come apart so soon. The second issue is that the zipper is now beginning to fail. When I go to zip up the bag, I have noticed that sometimes the other side of it will split. This is obviously a big safety issue since you wear it on your back and cannot always tell when the zipper has split and your belongings are unprotected. I have managed to fix this problem at times by sliding the zippers back all the way to the other side and jamming them down with some force and then rezipping them again, but this is an issue that continues to happen.
summary: I loved this bag right when I got it

I am, for the most part, an old-style jockstrap Man, and accustomed to heavy, rugged wide-band cotton pouch jocks like Bike. However, this is quite the sweet little swimmer-stle, low slung jockstrap, and it is way more comfortable than I thought it would be when it arrived. Like the other Chinese "fashion" jockstraps I've purchased, it quite comfortably provides the support I need without leaving me feeling crowded. Amazon kindly and wisely automatically "upsizes" this particular style, and a Large fits my 32" waist and other bits like a glove.

The most recent ones I ordered are a cool grey-green colour and, aside from the contrasting white stripes on the leg straps, there's also a white seam (piping?) that runs down the middle of the pouch, adding another nice visual effect. Made of an open-weave poly material, much like American football uniforms, this cute comfy jockstrap is both breathable and  stretchable and, like my classic style jocks, it holds up well to a day of work AND a hard workout at the end of the day. Just don't throw 'em in the "sturdy dirty" load with the rest of your workout gear, Guys. Wash 'em in COLD WATER with the delicates and air dry 'em!
summary: I LOVE This Cute Little Comfy Jockstrap!
